The strength and global reach of our platform is supported by our decentralized sales structure with a
wide network of local area managers, which enables us to be in close proximity to our key customers
worldwide, allowing us to establish and foster close relationships with industry players across geographies.
We believe our proximity to our customers enhances our ability to respond quickly to changing local
trends. In addition, our global scale enables us to source capacity from different locations based on supply
and demand levels so that we can serve our customers across multiple geographies depending on their
needs and requirements. As a result, we are able to develop new products and value added solutions that
meet the requirements of customers in our key end-markets while limiting our labor costs and creating
production synergies, all of which positions us well for future growth.

Our global platform of technologically advanced facilities is equipped with state-of-the-art
technologies, processing solutions, quality controls and machinery. Over the years, we have developed
proprietary production technologies that are crucial for the manufacture of technologically advanced
closures. As part of our efforts to make our manufacturing process more efficient by leveraging on
technological innovations, we regularly pilot and implement various projects across our manufacturing
facilities, including a multi-injection project in our facility in Colombia to develop closures made of
different plastics in the same mould in order to eliminate the assembly stage of our production process and
provide significant additional anti-counterfeiting protection to our closures. In addition, we focus on widescale flexible automation of our productions processes, which we plan to implement also for small and
medium-sized product batches. As customers increasingly demand more product customization, we believe
that our technologically advanced facilities position us to adapt to this market trend and meet the
increasingly complex specifications of our customers.

**_Long-standing and trusted blue chip customer relationships, high switching costs and diverse customer base_**

Our consistent product quality and customer service have allowed us to develop strong and longstanding relationships with our customers, both in mature and emerging markets. We enhance customer
loyalty through our research and development activities, which are often driven by the specific business
requirements of our customers. We have strong and long-standing relationships with most of the large
global producers of spirits, including Bacardi, Brown Forman, Campari, Diageo and Pernod Ricard, and
we work closely with individual brands owned by these producers. We also serve major wine producers,
such as Accolade, Castel, Caviro and Torres, Concha y Toro, Constellations Brands, Pernod Ricard and
Treasury wines. In addition, we serve a broad range of regional and local producers of spirits and wines
across all of our geographies. In 2020, approximately 30% and 70% of our net revenues was generated

130


-----

from sales of products to global and regional spirits producers, respectively. We have long-term
relationships with many of our customers, which in some cases exceed 30 years.

Due to the nature of bottle closures, we work in close partnership with leading spirits and wines
producers in the study, prototyping and development of highly innovative closures specifically designed for
their end-products, particularly safety and luxury closures, which often become integral parts of the overall
packaging design featured in their advertising campaigns. For example, we have developed the “Neptune”
closure for the SKYY Vodka brand, the “Florence” closure for Pernod Ricard’s Ballantine’s in both open
pourer and non-refillable versions and the luxury quality “Ultis” closure for Pernod Ricard’s Chivas
Whiskey. In recent years, the trend for customized solutions has resulted in the increase of the share of
products that we co-design and co-develop with our customers, particularly for luxury closures. For
example, we currently co-develop all of the luxury closures with premium spirit brands including, among
others, Macallan, William Grant’s, Haig Club, Dewar’s. The trend for customized solutions has also driven
the co-development of highly customized Safety closures with brands such as Jose Cuervo, Khortitsa and
Russian Standard. At the same time, we continue to develop products that can be sold to all customers in
specific end-markets, particularly in the wine and water closures market.

The high degree integration of our closures with customers’ end-products and the fact that our
closures are covered by patents or other forms of intellectual property protection, makes it more difficult
and costly for our customers to source alternative closures from our competitors. In addition, our longstanding, collaborative relationships with leading brands and our ability to leverage our global platform to
serve their needs across multiple geographies have allowed our closures to be used in our customers’
products globally, often becoming industry standard. In safety closures, we are typically the sole supplier
for a particular brand in a particular region. At the same time, our customer base is largely diversified and,
while certain of our customers own multiple brands, no single brand accounted for more than 3% of our
net revenue in 2019 and 2020.

As a result of the time and resources invested in joint product development activities with customers,
we also often receive recognition. For example, the e-closures equipped with NeˇSTGATE[™] NFC
technology that we launched in 2020 with Vigneti Massa, a well-established winemaker located in
Piedmont, Italy, received three prestigious awards in 2019: the Alufoil Trophy, the SIMEI Innovation
Challenge and the WorldStar Award. In addition, in February 2020 we received, together with Vigneti
Massa, a special prize for innovation in the wine sector at the inaugural Food & Wine Italia Awards.

We believe that the multinational scope of our operations and our ability to meet our customers’
quality standards across geographic markets are increasingly important factors to our large global
customers. In addition, our international presence allows us to operate in close physical proximity to our
customers’ production facilities and meet their product and design requirements with greater flexibility
and at a more competitive price and quality than our competitors.

**_Highly differentiated proprietary engineered product portfolio supported by a strong focus on research and_**
**_development_**

We believe that a key reason for our strong positioning in the global markets is the wide range of
products in our portfolio, which we sell to customers operating in four key end-markets: spirits, wine, water
and beverages, and olive oil and condiments. Our safety closures, which are highly engineered packaging
components generally consist of two to 12 different components, range from tamper-evident seals to more
sophisticated non-refillable devices covering the medium to high value added range of the closures market.
Our luxury closures, typically designed for high-end spirits produced in limited quantities, are made of
both aluminum and plastic, are customized according to the requirements of our customers and can
include ribbons, seals and unusual shapes. Our roll-on closures and other product lines provide a range of
products for spirits and mineral water and often provides an entry point for up-selling customers to other
higher value added product lines. Our roll-on for wine closures are made from aluminum and customers
can choose whether or not to include a tamper-evident band for protection against counterfeiting.

In line with our long-term commitment to design sustainable solutions and increasing customer focus
on sustainability in their own products, we recently developed and launched several sustainable solutions,
such as products of our Blossom[™] line, including Greencap[®], a fully removable and disposable aluminum
screwcap made of recycled materials, a luxury T-bar closure fully made of recycled ocean-diverted plastic
and agglomerated cork that we developed in collaboration with Oceanworks[®], the largest global
marketplace for sustainable materials, and Spring Blossom, a new aluminum closure for water with a
tamper-evident ring produced from completely bio-based polymers.

131


-----

Our research and development capabilities and our customer service functions enable us to
continuously improve and expand our product offering, including in response to customer feedback, and
the solutions we develop are often proprietary in nature and covered by patents, trade secrets and
know-how, all of which ensures our product portfolio remains differentiated.

**_Focus on innovation, technology and product development_**

We are committed to product research and development and the digitalization of packaging, and we
believe that we are a leading innovator in the closures industry, with a record of developing new and
enhanced products with improved functionality, reliability and sustainability. In addition, the increased
interconnectivity of our closures leads to closer integration between packaging suppliers and customers
during the designing, ordering and delivering phases as closures are closely tailored to customers’ needs.
We focus on the study, prototyping and development of highly engineered innovative solutions together
with selected partners, particularly for safety closures, and we protect our know-how by applying for
patents and other intellectual property protections for our products and processes. As of March 31, 2021,
we held, or had lodged applications for, more than 170 patents, including 113 active patent families,
10 utility model families, 5 combined patents and utility model families and 44 protected industrial designs.
Patents covered approximately 29% of our net revenue in the year ended December 31, 2020. The
proprietary nature of our products makes it more challenging for new market entrants to effectively
compete with us, as our research and development capabilities allow us to strengthen our relationships
with customers.

We operate five research and development centers in Italy, Scotland, Mexico, Ukraine and
Luxembourg. We believe that our developments allow us to derive a significant competitive advantage in
our markets because more advanced products generally provide us with higher margins. During the last
three years, we have launched over 35 new products. Examples of some of our most recent innovations
include various e-closures with fully integrated NFC capabilities, including our new series of e-closures
under the NeˇSTGATE[™] brand, which we started to develop in 2018, including the first wine bottles
equipped with NFC technology in Europe, which we launched in partnership with Vigneti Massa in 2020,
and e-closures specifically designed for Irish whiskey Jameson, which we launched in 2020. The NFC
technology is revolutionizing conventional bottle packaging by integrating connectivity features into bottle
closures for spirits, wine, olive oil and beverages. In particular, our NeˇSTGATE[™] e-closures are equipped
with a special microchip inside the capsule that is readable by all compatible smartphones, without
downloading any specific application, providing consumers with the certification of authenticity and
unlocking all information about the product, directly linking them to the brand and boosting customer
engagement and loyalty. Our NeˇSTGATE[™] product range also comprises various QR code-based as well
as more basic serial number-based models for wine and beverages. Most recently, we designed an
electronic tamper-evident closure equipped with proximity sensors capable of detecting nearby objects in
partnership with NXP Semiconductors, which we plan to launch in the coming months. Following our
recent acquisition of a minority stake in SharpEnd Partnership Ltd., an innovative technology services
agency based in London, we are able to offer our customers turnkey solutions, including digital platforms,
integrating hardware and software into connected packaging solutions.

We also have developed proprietary manufacturing processes that help reduce our operating costs
and improve our profitability. In certain cases, we work with our customers to develop new and more
competitive products. By offering support and by providing the technical expertise and service needed to
develop new products, we have enhanced our relationships with our customers. In addition, in order to
refresh our current product portfolio and meet the increasing demand for customized products, our
research and development team is currently developing a new series of products tailored for individual
brands and equipped with innovative technological and sustainable features and with a sophisticated
design, which we expect to launch between 2021 and 2023.

**_Proven track record of successful acquisitions focused on creating long-term value_**

Over the past two decades, our growth has been complemented through strategically identified
acquisitions and other business combinations and investments, which enabled us to strengthen our market
position and further increase our market share. In doing so, we have increased the number of geographical
markets in which we operate, including Australia, Bulgaria, France, Poland, South Africa, Ukraine,
Belarus, Germany and Turkey and have expanded our presence in new segments and the types of products
which we offer, including aluminum screwcaps for wine closures. More recently, in 2018, we acquired
United Closures and Plastics (now called Guala Closures UCP), a Scottish company with a long-standing

132


-----

presence in the Scottish market, which supplies some landmark scotch whisky brands. In 2020, we acquired
Closurelogic GmbH, a German manufacturer specializing in aluminum closures mainly intended for the
glass-bottle beverage and mineral water sector, as well as its Turkish subsidiary. In the same year, we
acquired a minority stake in SharpEnd Partnership Ltd., an innovative technology services agency based in
London focusing on integrating hardware and software into connected packaging solutions, which we
increased from 20% to 30% in the first quarter of 2021. We believe that we have been successful at
identifying and integrating acquired companies within the Group and at delivering synergies. Our success
in identifying and integrating acquired companies has contributed to the diversification of our geographic
and product category profile and the maintenance of attractive margins.

**_Best-in-class financial profile with proven resilience, with a decade of strong Adjusted EBITDA margins despite_**
**_foreign exchange rate and raw materials price fluctuations_**

We manage our business with a focus on achieving and maintaining a strong Adjusted EBITDA
margin as compared to those of our industry peers. We have a strong track-record of more than a decade
of revenue growth and stability of Adjusted EBITDA margins within a very narrow and consistent range.
We believe our business is resilient against the impact of adverse foreign exchange movements and raw
materials price fluctuations. Furthermore, we believe that the diversified nature of our end-markets and
customer base, coupled with our global presence have allowed us to maintain strong performance in 2020
despite the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. In addition, our Adjusted EBITDA margins are supported
by hedging arrangements covering a portion of our costs for raw materials via forward contracts. From
time to time, our Adjusted EBITDA margins are impacted by the initial dilutive effect of strategic
acquisitions; however, we strive to support our acquired businesses in order to maintain high group-wide
margins as we strive to achieve industry leading profitability. As a result, we believe our average Adjusted
EBITDA margin from 2015 to 2020 (including pre-merger Guala) was one of the three highest among our
direct competitors within the industry.

Our profit/(loss) for the years ended December 31, 2019 and 2020, for the twelve months ended
March 31, 2021, represented 2.4%, (1.0)% and (0.0%), respectively, of our net revenue. We have achieved
strong Adjusted EBITDA margins of 18.7%, 17.1% and 17.4% in the years ended December 31, 2019 and
2020, and in the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, respectively. We were able to achieve these results
leveraging both organic and inorganic growth, in spite of the fluctuations in exchange rates and raw
material prices and the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. Following the economic recovery starting in
the third and fourth quarter of 2020, our sales volumes returned to pre-pandemic levels. As a result, while
our net revenue in 2020 decreased by €34.5 million, or 5.7%, to €572.0 million from €606.5 million in 2019,
our Net Revenue at Constant Exchange Rates in 2020 decreased by only €2.7 million, or 0.4%, to
€603.8 million from €606.5 million in 2019. In the first quarter of 2021, our overall sales volumes continued
to improve despite the loss of volumes from sales in the European water and beverage market, which was
negatively impacted by the restrictions implemented in the HORECA industries due to the COVID-19
pandemic. As a result, while net revenue decreased by €7.6 million, or 5.2%, from €145.9 million for the
three months ended March 31, 2020 to €138.3 million for the three months ended March 31, 2021, our Net
Revenue at Constant Exchange Rates in the first quarter of 2021 increased by €1.3 million, or 0.9%, from
€145.9 million in the first quarter of 2020 to €147.2 million. Our resilient industry leading margins coupled
disciplined approach to working capital and capital expenditure led to a strong Adjusted cash conversion
ratio of 88% in each of the years ended December 31, 2019 and 2020. The above information should be
read in conjunction with the information contained in “Presentation of Financial and Other Information”,
and “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations”.

**_Strong focus on ESG and sustainability by pursuing ambitious targets_**

Over the past decade, we have developed a strong focus on sustainability and ESG issues and
strived to reduce the impact of our products and operations on the environment and climate change.
Going forward, we intend to continue to focus on sustainability and ESG and have developed a
comprehensive strategy to optimize sustainability across our operations and identified a series of
sustainability targets. We have made a long-term commitment to the design of sustainable solutions and
have been, together with selected partners, studying, prototyping and developing closures made of
materials with a low environmental impact over their life cycle, including recycled aluminum and
recycled polymers as well as biopolymers and composite polymers. In 2020, recycled materials
represented 27% of the raw materials used in our products and we intend to increase this percentage to
35% by the end of 2025. Our product portfolio already comprises several sustainable products under the

133


-----

umbrella brand Blossom[™], including Greencap[®], a fully removable and disposable aluminum screwcap
made of recycled materials, a luxury T-bar closure fully made of recycled ocean-diverted plastic and
Spring Blossom, a new aluminum closure for water with a tamper-evident ring produced from
completely bio-based polymers. In line with our long-term commitment on sustainability, we intend to
increase the share of environmentally-friendly solutions in our portfolio, by extending our existing range
of sustainable closures and developing new solutions.

In order to protect the environment, meet sustainability needs and contribute to the mitigation of the
effects of climate change, we focus on minimizing environmental pollution, reducing waste, increasing
energy and water savings and using renewable energy. We estimate that in 2020 we reduced our Scope
1 & 2 Greenhouse Gas Emissions per ton of finished products by approximately 8% compared to 2016,
and we intend to decrease such emissions further by optimizing processes and optimizing loads and
logistics across our supply chain. In addition, in the first quarter of 2021, we implemented “Iris”, a new
software developed entirely in-house, at our Spinetta Marengo facility in Italy, which is able to connect
150 pieces of machinery simultaneously, perform data analysis and make recommendations to the facility’s
operator in line with our key sustainability principles. Going forward, we plan to implement Iris at all our
facilities worldwide.

**_Experienced and committed management team supported by clear and simple reporting lines and a decentralized_**
**_sales structure_**

We benefit from the experience of our key management who each have decades of experience in the
closures and packaging industry. In addition, in 2021 we welcomed our new Chief Executive Officer,
Mr. Gabriele del Torchio, who brings a wealth of experience in running high profile businesses and a track
record of approximately 45 years in managing industrial companies. Management has consistently
demonstrated its ability to develop our business by anticipating market trends and dynamics, creating
significant added value for customers and entering new geographies and product markets, underpinned by
clear and simple reporting lines directly to the Chief Operating Officer, who is supported by two regional
managers for the Americas and the Asia Pacific region, and by decentralized local sale structure with a
strong network of area managers responsible for day-to-day relationships with local customers. Our
effective management structure has also allowed us to take swift action in response to the weak global
economic environment in past years, including headcount reductions, temporary plant shutdowns and exits
from non-core markets, and in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. In recent years, management has
continued to implement cost reduction measures and to improve cash flow management while pursuing
our strategy to enter new geographies and product markets through organic growth and by acquiring and
successfully integrating companies already operating in our industry.

**Business strategy**

We aim to maintain our market leadership as a large-scale producer of specialty closures and to
continue growing our business while enhancing our profitability by growing our revenue, reducing our cost
base and expanding our product portfolio. Our strategy to achieve these objectives includes the following
key elements:

**_Continue to invest in product development and digitalization and cross-sell or up-sell high end products to existing_**
**_customers_**

Competition in our key market segments is focused mainly on product quality, innovation,
digitalization, sustainability and customer service. As a result, we believe that developing reliable products
with innovative functional features, aesthetic appeal and other improvements are necessary for enhancing
demand for our products. We plan to continue improving our product offering technologically and
innovatively by developing new ranges of safety closures that offer varying degrees of protection against
counterfeiting while promoting our customers’ brand images worldwide. In particular, we plan to continue
to focus on the digitalization of our closures by offering more products equipped with innovative
technological features, such as NFC microchips and QR code-based solutions. We will continue to work
closely with our customers to develop new and more innovative solutions and we believe that the
increasing digitalization of closures will lead to even closer integration with our customers’ end-products
and will position us for further growth. In addition, we intend to develop new aesthetically appealing styles
to complement existing products and meet the growing marketing requirements of our customers. We also
intend to encourage customers of our roll-on closures to upgrade and convert to more sophisticated,
aesthetic, luxurious and protective safety closures where appropriate. In order to refresh our current

134


-----

product portfolio and meet the increasing demand for customized products, our research and development
team is currently developing a new series of products tailored for individual brands and equipped with
innovative technological and sustainable solutions and with a sophisticated design, which we expect to
launch between 2021 and 2023.

**_Increase sales of premium products through a focus on safety and luxury closures across different geographies_**

In recent years, we have expanded our global presence and we believe we are the leading producer of
safety closures by volume in several emerging markets, including Colombia, India, Mexico and Ukraine. In
2019, we started our operations in Africa following the inauguration of Guala Closures East Africa’s new
facility in Kenya and opened a new facility in Belarus. In 2020, we entered the Turkish market following
our acquisition of Closurelogic GmbH and its assets in Turkey. We intend to continue our geographical
expansion by consolidating our presence in these and other markets, with a particular focus on specialty
closures for the spirits market, including added-value safety and luxury closures.

According to a study that we commissioned from a global management company, the global spirits
closures market has grown at a compound annual growth rate of approximately 2% between 2016 and
2019, reaching approximately 37 billion closures in 2019, of which approximately 18 billion units in our key
focus regions of India, Russia, the United States, the United Kingdom, Poland, Ukraine and Mexico.
According to this study, the market for safety closures represented approximately 38% of the global spirits
closures market in 2019, while 42% was represented by roll-on closures. Despite the negative impact from
the COVID-19 pandemic, which resulted in a 9% decrease in the size of the spirits closures market in our
key focus regions in 2020, a strong rebound is expected in 2021, with a full recovery predicted to occur
between 2021 and 2022, on a country-by-country basis. In particular, it is expected that the global spirits
closures market will grow at a compound annual growth rate of approximately 2.5% between 2021 and
2024, mainly driven by growth in the safety and luxury closures markets, which are expected to grow at a
compound annual growth rate of approximately 4% and 5%, respectively, between 2021 and 2024.

We expect significant growth for the specialty closures segments in emerging markets. In recent years,
these markets have experienced an increase in the consumption of branded spirits. We believe this has
resulted in a greater demand for sophisticated anti-counterfeiting systems (such as our non-refillable safety
closures) by the producers of such spirits and we expect such demand to continue to grow. In addition,
producers are increasingly using safety closures as a marketing tool to create a premium brand image
through the use of exclusive packaging.

We believe that our leading position means that we are well placed to benefit from the expected
future growth in the safety closures market worldwide, including in emerging markets. We aim to take
advantage of this trend by sustaining or increasing our presence in these markets. We intend to achieve
this by strengthening our relationships with drinks producers and consolidating our presence and
infrastructure in the relevant countries.

**_Position the Group to benefit from expected growth in the market for wine closures and bottled water_**

According to a study that we commissioned from a global management company, the aluminum
screwcaps for wine closures market grew at a compound annual growth rate of approximately 3% between
2016 and 2019, as a result of evolving consumer habits and the ability of screwcaps to preserve product
quality while having a low incidence on the price and costs of packaging. The screwcap market has also
demonstrated a higher resiliency to the negative impact of the COVID-19 pandemic compared to the
overall closures market, showing a strong rebound in 2021 to date, which we expect will continue, and an
expected growth at a compound annual growth rate of approximately 3% between 2021 and 2024. We
believe that aluminum winecaps today account for approximately 23% of all bottled wine worldwide and
we believe that we are well positioned to capitalize on future growth in this industry, especially as large
regions such as North America and Europe move towards greater usage of aluminum winecaps.

We believe we are one of the top producers of aluminum winecap closures, with a market share by
volume of units sold in 2019 of approximately 30%. We expect growth in the wine closures market to
continue due to increasing end-consumer preference for aluminum closures rather than cork. We believe
that our leading position in this market means we are well placed to benefit from this growth. We aim to
take advantage of this trend by sustaining or increasing our presence this end-market, by strengthening our
relationships with wine producers, particularly those which are also active in the spirits market, by
developing new and aesthetically attractive closures, including closures with safety elements and innovative
features, and by consolidating our operations in the countries and regions where wine closures are
purchased in large volumes.

135


-----

According to a study that we commissioned from a global management company, the market for
closures for bottled water, measured by closures unit, grew at a compound annual growth rate of
approximately 5% between 2015 and 2019, and is expected to grow further a compound annual growth rate
of approximately 6% between 2021 and 2024, mainly driven by growth in population and increased shift
towards healthier beverages. In particular, the premium market for glass water bottles is expected to grow
at a compound annual growth rate of approximately 7% over the same timeframe. We believe we are
currently recognized as a key closure producer in the premium market for glass water bottles, particularly
following our acquisition of Closurelogic, a German manufacturer specializing in aluminum closures
mainly intended for the glass-bottle beverage and mineral water sector, in 2020. Going forward, we intend
to take advantage of these strong growth trends in the glass-bottle closures market by leveraging our core
business technology in metal screw caps for spirit closures as well as our expertise in tamper-evident
systems.

**_Carry out further selected acquisitions in core and adjacent markets_**

During the last 10 years, we have grown both organically and through strategically identified
acquisitions. In doing so we have increased the number of geographical markets in which we operate (for
example, we established our presence in Australia, Bulgaria, France, Poland, South Africa, Ukraine,
Belarus, Germany and Turkey) and expanded our presence in new segments and the types of products
which we offer. Most recently, in 2018, we acquired Guala Closures UCP, a Scottish company with a
long-standing presence in the Scottish market, and in 2020, we acquired Closurelogic GmbH, a German
manufacturer specialising in aluminum closures mainly intended for the glass-bottle beverage and mineral
water sector, as well as its Turkish subsidiary. In the same year, we also acquired a minority stake in
SharpEnd Partnership Ltd., an innovative technology services agency based in London focusing on
integrating hardware and software into connected packaging solutions. In the first quarter of 2021, we
increased our stake in SharpEnd Partnership Ltd. from 20% to 30%. We believe that we have been
successful at identifying and integrating acquired companies and at exploiting the synergies offered by such
acquisitions. Going forward, we intend to continue to identify appropriate expansion opportunities where
we consider it would help us grow in new geographical markets with high levels of alcohol consumption
that we view as underpenetrated including, for example, South Africa and certain countries in Asia. In
addition, we intend to continue to identify appropriate acquisitions and other development opportunities
that would allow us to consolidate our position in the market for aluminum and plastics closures, and
diversify our business through the expansion in the market for closures made of alternative materials such
as cork as well as in adjacent product markets, such as food and beverages, including water, beauty and the
pharmaceutical industries.

**_Further improve operational efficiency by optimizing manufacturing and the supply chain_**

The optimization and automation of our manufacturing processes and the investment in new
equipment for our technologically advanced plants is one of our core areas of focus and going forward we
expect to continue to invest in innovative technologies for supply chain management in order to optimize
our production and supply chain network efficiency. To further improve the efficiency of our production
processes, we aim to (i) modernize and automate our production processes on a wide-scale through our
flexible automation project, including for small and medium-sized product batches, which we believe will
enable us to respond promptly to evolving market needs; (ii) continue to advance our production processes
by implementing systems to monitor and improve our entire production cycles (the “continuous
improvement” program) and our multi-injection project aimed at eliminating the assembly stage of the
manufacturing process; and (iii) hedge part of the risks of price fluctuation in the purchase price of
aluminum through forward purchases on the London Metal Exchange through the use of hedging
depending on the commodity price environment. We endeavor to leverage key focus platforms across the
Group and improve profitability of selected sites opportunistically.

**_Continue prudent financial management, focusing on liquidity, deleveraging, Net Working Capital and hedging of_**
**_raw materials_**

We believe that the Group has benefited from prudent financial management throughout its history,
with a particular focus on cost reduction and cash flow management. We intend to use our cash flow
generation capacity, and our Revolving Credit Facility, to maintain appropriate levels of liquidity and Net
Working Capital in order to enable us to respond to unexpected changes in economic conditions. We will
continue to monitor our capital expenditures carefully in order to benefit from favorable economic

136


-----

conditions and be able to take advantage of opportunities for acquisitions, and to continue to implement
the Group’s strategy, particularly in emerging markets. We will also continue to carefully monitor
fluctuations in the prices of raw materials, both aluminum and plastics, and changes in prevailing currency
exchange rates. We intend to manage raw material price fluctuations by hedging our exposures where
appropriate as well as currency fluctuations by matching revenue to expenditure in each currency where
possible.

**History**

We commenced operations in 1954 as a manufacturer of plastic closures for spirits. Early in our
development we adopted an international focus, initially by licensing our products to local producers and
later by establishing a direct presence in the markets we targeted. Over the last two decades, we have
expanded our product lines and geographic markets through both organic growth and acquisitions. Prior to
the 2018 Business Combination, our expansion has included the commencement in 2015 of production
operations in Chile, the acquisition in 2016 of 70% of CapMetal SAS in France (since renamed Guala
Closures France SAS), a company specialized in the production of aluminum screwcaps, and the
acquisitions in 2017 of Axiom, a leading Indian company active in the production of safety closures for
spirits, of the activities of Limat S.A. de C.V., a Mexican company specialized in the manufacturing of
wood overcaps for top-range spirit bottles, and of the screw cap activities of Industria Corchera S.A.
(“ICSA”) in Chile.

On July 31, 2018, pre-merger Guala, was acquired by Space4, a special purpose acquisition company
and it merged by incorporation into Space4 on August 6, 2018 with the resulting entity concurrently
adopting Guala’s corporate name, Guala Closures S.p.A., and transferring its registered office to Guala’s
registered office, Via Rana 12, 15122, Alessandria, Spinetta Marengo, Italy. On the same date, our
ordinary shares and Market Warrants were admitted to and started trading on the Star segment of the
Italian Stock Exchange (Mercato Telematico Azioniario) and in September 2019, we were admitted to the
FTSE Italy Mid Cap index.

Following our admission to trading on the Italian Stock Exchange, we continued the expansion of our
product lines and geographic reach. In 2018, we acquired Guala Closures UCP, a Scottish company with a
long-standing presence in the Scottish market, which supplies closures to some landmark scotch whisky
brands. In 2019, we started our operations in Africa following the inauguration of Guala Closures East
Africa’s new facility in Kenya and opened a new facility in Belarus. In 2020, we acquired Closurelogic
GmbH, a German manufacturer specializing in aluminum closures mainly intended for the glass-bottle
beverage and mineral water sector, as well as its Turkish subsidiary. In 2020, we also acquired a minority
stake in SharpEnd Partnership Ltd., an innovative technology services agency based in London focusing on
integrating hardware and software into connected packaging solutions, such as closures equipped with
NFC capabilities. The graphic below provides an overview of our key acquisitions, business combinations
and investments from 2002 to 2020.

**Our divisions and product lines**

We have historically divided our operations into two divisions: Closures and PET. The Closures
division represents our core business and produces a wide range of closures for diversified end-markets.
The PET division mainly produces standard and custom moulds, PET bottle and miniatures.

Our Closures division represents our core business, which is specialized in the following product lines:
Safety closures, Luxury closures, Roll-on closures and Roll-on for wine closures. Safety and Luxury
closures are specialty closures.

In 2019, we reorganized our business structure to focus on our Closures division. We sold part of the
Spanish assets of our PET division to third parties and transferred the remaining PET assets from Spain to
the United Kingdom. As a result, we no longer consider the PET division a core business. The PET
division is now closely connected to the Closures division as customers in the spirit sector are the same and
because the PET division’s activities are substantially an accessory market related to the sale of closures to
our customers. As a result of this reorganization, sales generated in our Closures division and from sales of
PET products accounted for 99.5% and 0.5% of our net revenue, respectively, in the year ended
December 31, 2020.

In 2019, following the partial divestment of our PET division and the sale of GCL Pharma S.r.l., which
operated our pharma product line, we changed the presentation of our segmentation by product. In
particular, we no longer consider it a core business of the Group and no longer report our PET revenues
separately. For reporting purposes, we include revenues from sales of products manufactured by our PET
division, together with residual revenues not in included in any of the other product lines, under the
residual category “Other”.

_Safety closures_

We produce safety closures almost exclusively for spirits, wine and vegetable oil products, which are
fitted with special devices to limit counterfeiting of the end-product, such as non-refillable devices. We are
the world’s leading producer of safety closures for spirits, with a market share by volume of units sold
worldwide in 2019 of more than 60%. Safety closures are primarily made of plastics and have a complex
structure that generally consist of two to 12 different components. Our safety closures are designed to
prevent our competitors from imitating our closures and their unique components. The features of our
safety closures products can include tamper-evident seals, non-refillable valve systems, positive lock
systems and aluminum cladding. Safety closures are primarily used by our customers when selling their
products in emerging markets, where the risk of counterfeiting is higher.

We have been active in the production of safety closures since the 1970s when we launched the
famous 1031 model safety closure. Most of our older patents related to the creation of innovative solutions
for tamper-evident and tamper proofing features in closures with these features being implemented
alongside new designs of plastic components and the interaction of plastic components with aluminum
shells. Our more recent patent applications take advantage of new technologies, in an innovative manner
and for the first time in the closures field, include production cost savings and sustainable methods (for
waste reduction) as well as improvements in the efficiency of tamper-evident and anti-counterfeiting
measures.

_Luxury closures_

Our luxury closures product line specializes in the production of customized plastic, wood and
aluminum closures, typically designed for high-end spirits that are produced in limited quantities. We focus
on aesthetic appeal and design and use advanced decoration techniques, including 3D embossing and
metal sputtering, to customize closures. These closures are designed to give a more distinctive character to
our customers’ brands and to improve the aesthetic appeal of their end-products. Luxury closures can be
designed to suit different brand and market requirements. Our leadership in the Safety and Roll-on
closures segments facilitated our penetration in the Luxury closures market, particularly because often the
customers of these closures are the same and we have been able to leverage our long-standing
relationships with their procurement, technical and marketing representatives for Safety and Roll-on
closures, who are typically also responsible of Luxury closures.

Our luxury closures collection includes:

   - Gravitas, closures made of a new patented material that brings together the versatility of plastic and
luxury feel of metal material;

   - Essence, customized closures made of high quality natural wood;

   - Icon, closures which feature a combination of materials and technologies that gives closures a
touchable appearance;

   - Torq, closures which combine the retention properties of a screw thread with the premium feel of a
cork; and

   - Opéra, closures made of eccentric materials with a noble and contemporary touch.

_Roll-on closures_

We produce roll-on closures for spirits, mineral water, vegetable oil and condiments sectors (such as
those for olive oil and vinegar). We believe that we are the largest producer of standard aluminum closures
in Europe. Our roll-on closures also include closures for bottles of soft drinks and beer. Our Roll-on
closures portfolio ranges from the simplest screwcaps to more customized solutions decorated with
advanced techniques, such as lithography, hot-foil, relief or bas-relief punching. Roll-on closures are
primarily made out of aluminum and can typically comprise up to four different components. Our products
comprise (i) long and short aluminum closures fitted with a thread enabling them to be screwed directly
onto the neck of the bottle and (ii) aluminum closures with plastic components enabling special functions,
such as anti-drop spouts (mainly designed for olive oil bottles) or flow inhibitors (mainly designed for
vinegar bottles).

We seek to, where appropriate, migrate customers from Roll-on closures to higher margin Safety
closures through a process of customer education and product innovation.

_Roll-on for wine closures_

Aluminum screwcap closures specifically dedicated to the wine sector are easy to open and convenient
to store as well as lower cost than traditional cork closures. Screwcap closures for wine offer further
advantage to natural and synthetic corks for bottled wine as screwcaps are not susceptible to natural cork
taint issues and, therefore, do not create a risk of spoiling the wine contained in the bottle. Demand for
aluminum screwcaps closures for wine has increased in recent years, and in 2020 aluminum screwcap
closures were used on approximately 23% of all bottled wine worldwide.

Flat coated and printed aluminum sheets are pressed to produce the closure shell, which is then
finished to meet the customer’s needs through the use of printing machines. Our Roll-on wine closures
product line includes a range of product and technological features, including decoration, concealed
threading, tamper-evident band, pressure retention and varying levels of permeability including by use of
controlled OTR liners. Our key Roll-on for wine closures include the Liners by Oneoseal[®], which we
started developing together with Manufacture Generale de Joints in 2015, including:

  - Onyx, liners equipped with an aluminum layer to ensure maximum impermeability to oxygen;

   - Ivory, liners that enable the amount of free sulfur dioxide (SO2) to be reduced when bottling; and

   - Coral, liners that reduce evaporation of wines with high tannin.

The market for aluminum screwcaps for wine closures continues to grow strongly as a result of the
superior performance of aluminum closures compared to traditional cork closures. The market growth has
been driven by wine producers in New Zealand, Australia, Chile, Argentina and South Africa, which
preferred aluminum screwcaps over cork ones for various reasons, including practicality of use and cost
benefits, and is expected to be driven in the future by greater use of aluminum screwcaps for wine closures
in Europe, the U.S. and Latin America, where we perceive significant potential for further growth.
During the years, we expanded our presence in the wine closures market through a series of
acquisitions, including Global Cap in 2003, Auscap in Australia in 2007, 70% of DGS in Poland in 2011,
MCG in South Africa in 2012 and 70% of CapMetal SAS (since renamed Guala Closures France SAS) in
France in 2016. In 2015, we commenced production operations in Chile, bolstered with our acquisition in
2017 of the screw cap activities of ICSA in Chile. More recently, in February 2020, we expanded our
production of wine closures in Europe through the acquisition of Closurelogic GmbH, a German
manufacturer specialising in aluminum closures mainly intended for the glass-bottle beverage and mineral
water. We believe that we are the leading producer of aluminum screwcaps for wine closures, with
approximately 30% market share by volume of units sold in 2019.

_Other_

Other includes PET products (such as bottles, jars, and miniature flasks for drinks, containers for

scrap) and other residual amounts not included in the foregoing product lines. From the year ended

Our PET products comprise the custom molding line, which manufactures bottles, moldings, jars,
flasks and miniature bottles, with capacities ranging from 20 milliliters to a maximum of 5 liters, and with
bottle neck diameters ranging from 18 mm to 110 mm.

For the year ended December 31, 2020 and the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, Other
generated net revenue amounting to €21.6 million and €19.4 million, representing 3.8% and 3.4%,

_Spirits_

We are a renowned key partner in the spirits markets. Through technological innovation, we offer
spirits makers solutions that increasingly prevent counterfeiting while meeting their needs for
premiumization and differentiation.

143


-----

In the spirits end-market, we primarily sell safety, luxury and roll-on aluminum closures to some of the
most prestigious multinational producers of spirits (such as Bacardi, Brown Forman, Campari, Diageo and
Pernod Ricard). We also sell our products to a number of important regional producers in many of the
countries in which we operate (such as state distilleries in Colombia, large whisky producers in India, and
vodka producers in Russia).

In the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, net revenue generated in the spirits end-market
represented 61.0% of our net revenue for the period.

_Wine_

With screw-on aluminum closures, wine is more stable over time and its balance is not compromised
during transport. Our caps are designed to facilitate opening and closing the bottle and feature liners that
limit the oxygenation of the wine so the wine retains its quality and flavour for a longer period of time.

In the wine end-market, we primarily sell roll-on aluminum closures to wine producers. The principal
customers of our wine closures are major wine producers (such as Accolade, Castel, Caviro and Torres,
Concha y Toro, Constellations Brands, Pernod Ricard and Treasury wines) as well as a number of
important regional players (such as Casella in New Zealand, Distell in South Africa and The Wine Group
in the United States).

In the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, net revenue generated in the wine end-market
represented 20.8% of our net revenue for the period.

_Water and beverages_

We produce aluminum closures for carbonated and still beverages in glass bottles, fruit juice and
non-alcoholic beverages. We supply some of the top international brands with generic closures or tamperevident closures that feature capsules based on a patented system to show when a bottle has been opened.

In the water and beverages end-market, we primarily sell roll-on aluminum closures to producers of
mineral water, such as Ferrarelle, Nestlé Waters and San Benedetto.

In the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, net revenue generated in the water and beverages
end-market represented 10.6% of our net revenue for the period.

_Olive oil and condiments_

We offer the oil sector a varied range of long and short capsules, spouts specifically designed for the
viscosity of oil, and non-drip devices to prevent dripping at the end of the pour.

In the oil and condiments end-market, we primarily sell roll-on aluminum closures to producers of
olive oil, such as Carapelli, Deoleo, Unilever and Farchioni group, and vinegar, such as the Ponti group.

In the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, net revenue generated in the olive oil and condiments
end-market represented 2.5% of our net revenue for the period.

_Other markets_

We also sell our products to customers in a broad range of other end-markets, including the
pharmaceutical market for PET products.

In the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, net revenue generated in other end-market represented

We have had relationships with many of our customers for over 30 years. Our top five closures

Purchasing decisions by our major clients are rarely centralized and are usually made by managers
responsible for a single product or brand. With our major customers we enter into a general framework
agreement which governs dealings between the parties. Such arrangements generally specify the closure
models required, volumes and procedures for determining the purchase price during the term of the
contract. Usually a schedule of expected delivery quantities and dates is supplied at regular intervals which
enables us to co-ordinate our procurement of raw materials. In order to confirm a particular delivery date
and quantity, the customer sends us a purchase order containing the relevant information.

**Competition**

We are active in the design and production of safety, luxury and roll-on closures for spirits, wine,
water and beverages, olive oil and other products on a worldwide basis.

The broad selection of our closures and our significant diversification means that we face competition
from different global and local competitors, which we believe are made up as follows:

   - non-specialized main competitors, who produce spirits and wine closures on a global scale, without
particular specialization in any product;

   - specialized main competitors, or medium-sized competitors highly specialized, among others, in
spirits or wine closures;

   - non-specialized competitors, who produce packaging on a global scale, with limited market share
for spirits and wine closures; and

   - small, local manufacturers.

Our competitive advantages compared to other peers in the closures market include:

   - our ability to satisfy our customers’ requests, particularly in the spirits market where customers tend
to use one manufacturer per product;

   - our ability to meet specific requests from the market, especially in the safety and luxury market; and

   - pricing, in particular in the markets of roll-on closures and wine closures.
